"

The winner is the first to fill all the beds.

There are {0, number, integer} beds marked out across the board and a vertical line on each side.

Each player has a turn sliding their {1, number, integer} coins up the board with the aim of coins ending in a bed to score.

A coin that does not reach the first bed may be replayed.

At the end of a player''s turn, any valid scores are added to that player''s score for the bed.

Once they have a total score of {2, number, integer} for a bed, that bed is considered filled.

If the bed has already been filled, that bed''s scores will go to the opponent (unless doing so would cause a win).

The follow-on rule {5, choice, 0# is not active | 1# is active}, so coins that score may {5,choice,0#not be replayed|1#be replayed}.

Coins that strike the sides will {3, choice, 0# fall off the sides | 1# bounce off the sides}.

Coins crossing the side rails will {4, choice, 0# still be valid | 1# not be valid} for scoring.

"
